website_summaries.verdict: Design of this shoe attempts to mold tightly to your foot, providing maximum balance and comfort.
pros: Provides quite a bit of stability because of the way it forms to your foot
Rubber sole on the shoe, protects your foot from sharp rocks on the trail
Includes a sock liner that's easily washable
cons: Seams on the inside of the shoe near toe box may not fit everyone properly

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes for the trail!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, good grip on muddy trail, not too "knobbly" on the road. Not quite as much protection as e.g. the spyridon when you hit a patch of sizable, pointy gravel or super gnarly roots, but a great all-round shoe for lighter trails. I have owned these for several weeks, used them for some road and some trail running, and the occasional walk. Only thing I didn't like about them is that they give off their dye - my feet are blue after use, and take a lot of scrubbing to get clean. :/
customer_reviews.author: Andrej Ricnik

customer_reviews.title: Love These Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! Been wearing Vibrams about a year now. I put about 10 miles on these ones in the first few weeks then did a very tough mountainous 30k trail run in them: AMAZING. Of course my feet were sore/tired, but not from the shoes! My feet felt relatively great compared to similar trail runs in expensive custom trail runners. As far as this style of shoe goes, they’re comfortable: no little things poking your ankle or the back rubbing tendon on the back of your ankle. Please note: no one is exaggerating when you read it will take some time to transition.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & suitable replacement for old Spyridon
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace a pair of old Spyridons that I wore holes in. Since the Spyridon MR Elite is way wider than the original Spyridon, I had to get the V Trail Runner instead. The V Trail Runner fits pretty much exactly the same as the old Spyridon, though it has more padding around the ankle. For activity I use them mostly to play ultimate frisbee. So lots of sudden starts, stops, changing direction, etc. I've been using this shoe for a few months now and am quite satisfied with it. They're holding up well so far, and is a worthy replacement for the old Spyridon.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Free Foot Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these shoes. I bought these for mud running obstacle courses and adore them. They feel great on my feet. I have bunions on both feet and often struggle with finding shoes that I can wear comfortably for long periods of time. Typical athletic shoes make my feet feel cramped and weighty. These give me enough of that "free foot" feel and are so light. I love running and hiking in them. They do let water in if it’s deep, but the material helps keep the shoes from getting soggy and squishy, unlike normal athletic shoes. I recommend wearing toe socks with them, as the back part of the shoe does rub slightly on the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: CherohalaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The Death of the Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing! Having had a set of Fila Skeletoes before, and having loved the idea of toeshoes, I bought these, deciding that the investment in what I considered good footwear to be worth it. And, boy was I right! My feet stopped hurting after the first day, and after 3, normal shoes just won't do it anymore. So, be warned! If you buy these, you may never be able to wear traditional footwear comfortably again!
customer_reviews.author: Lord Ethanos Lionsmane

customer_reviews.title: New design, but not proven better
customer_reviews.text: My previous pairs of Vibrams had a strap/velcro system that supported your arch 10x better than this design. I spent $100 on them and they lasted 5 years - no pair of shoes does that. These seem to take three steps backwards to make more sales by trying to resemble a standard athletic shoe. Still fit ok, but bunching in places. I want my old design back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Long overdue; my first Vibrams.
customer_reviews.text: Having been eyeballing them since I first heard of them oh so many years ago, I finally took the plunge and picked up my first pair of Vibrams after my beloved sandals began falling apart on me in such a way that no amount of stitching and Amazing Goop could keep repaired. I'm now comfortably beyond the honeymoon period, and loving them all the more. The only complaint I do have is that I quickly noticed that the outer material looks to have been tearing slightly when I was using the heel loop to pull them on. Nothing too major, and easily prevented by switching it up for a more standard "finger shoehorn" method.
customer_reviews.author: Fsac

customer_reviews.title: I expected something different
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. I thought that this would make me comfortable and help with my herniated disc. They fit well, but i think if it was just a few centimeters bigger it would've fit perfect. I wore it for 21 days, and had to stop because It was hurting my spine and my feet too much. Putting them on and taking them off is worse than putting on a Converse high-top. It would take me 10 minutes to put them on and another 10 minutes to take them off. It was a good experience, but i don't see myself wearing this as much as i wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: Bashier Abdin

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Looking Forward to Working Out With Them
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today, and they feel great. I normally wear 10.5 shoes and these fit perfectly. There doesn't seem to be any unusual rubbing or issues. The top is very soft on my foot. I have never worn these types of shoes before, but I did take the advice and started with my big toe first and it didn't take long to get the rest of my toes in the right places. I am going to take the advice I was given and work to break them in a bit before getting too crazy with them. I will do my work out tomorrow and we will see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Back of Shoe VERY HIGH on Achilles; Go Up One Size (Fit)
customer_reviews.text: The V Trail has a VERY HIGH BACK of shoe that will rub your skin off if you don't wear socks. Even if you do wear the five-toed socks, the this shoe will probably push the back of the sock down to the heel during the run. And, you will have your skin rubbed raw by the shoe. As for fit: it runs small. I had to buy size 40 rather than the usual 39. No issues with the width of shoe. There's quite of bit of padding inside the shoe around the foot and it felt weird. I'm returning this shoe because of the high back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Juniper

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes and I love wearing them despite the weird ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes and I love wearing them despite the weird looks and curious questions I always receive on them. I religiously wear size 12 shoes but with socks I have to wear the size 11-11.5 in these. Because my feet are a little longer and thinner, the sides do bunch up a little so they don't fit like a glove as compared to a previous pair I had. So, the stability isn't 100% as I had expected while my feet are in these, but they are still wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one size up, fits great!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered these according to the size chart, but had to return them and order a size larger, but I have very fat feet on the top. I will buy more vibrams in the future but i'll probably continue to order a size up! Follow the directions on how to break them in, because the first couple of weeks I would wear them for a bit around the house and they were uncomfortable. But now that I've grown accustomed to them they are the only shoes I want to wear. I would not wear this pair while running or jogging though, I think vibram makes better shoes for running. This is better for walking and trails!
customer_reviews.author: P and A Alter

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed with a little more structure than the Ascents.
customer_reviews.text: The Trail Runner's upper has some padding in the arch, heel and around the ankle. The soles provide good protection from road debris for me and are very comfortable. These are my second pair of toe shoes, my first pair being Trek Ascents and I love them both with the Ascents being lighter and constructed of thinner fabric throughout the shoe's upper. I like the speed lacing on the Ascents better than the regular lacing and Velcro closure on the Trail Runners but both work as they should and the lacing difference would not be a major decision maker for me.
customer_reviews.author: G Franklin

customer_reviews.title: These are great! Kind of hard to get used to guiding ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Kind of hard to get used to guiding one's toes into them, but I am getting the hang of it. Very comfortable. I also bought Amarey toe socks, and they work well with these Trail Runners. The only downside is that it is even harder to guide one's toes into the Trail Runners when wearing toe socks! But, somewhat surprisingly, the Trail Runners feel hotter/less ventilated *without* socks, so I always wear them with socks now. I have not tried running yet with the Trail Runners, as I'm following the instructions to ease into their use. I have used them on ellipticals, and I prefer them to other footwear.
customer_reviews.author: S.D. Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you order a size larger than normal!
customer_reviews.text: I'm late getting into the toe shoe game, but these are great! The only advice I can give is to take your usual size and then round up! I had to send two different pair back and finally order this third pair that fits but they are much larger than I would normally order. But otherwise, they are a great shoe. Just make sure you order the toe socks to go with so you don't blister up, and if you are new to the game like I was, take your time breaking yourself in with them. I wore them for 4 hours the first day and I could tell that my cats were getting more of a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Dread Pirate Roberts

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and amazing on my back
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and I never want traditional shoes again. So comfortable and amazing on my back. If you aren't a barefoot kind of person you have to remember to not kick anything too hard as they are not made like normal shoes and you do not have the same toe protection. Some of us however watch our feet. My only dislike is that the edges come unglued after a year or so. My last pair is still in excellent condition other than that. I really think the sole should be stitched at the edges. I will be doing so with my old pair as they are just AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Mentalconstruct

customer_reviews.title: Next best thing to barefoot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of five fingered shoes, the first I only used in the gym. This pair I just did a 5mile trail (everything from pavement, sand, dirt, gravel and a wooden boardwalk) to try them out and I love them. They work very well lots of traction. They are almost like barefoot but with a rubber sole so you don't hurt your feet while walking. My only complaint and the reason for not getting the full 5 stars, twice I had to stop and get gravel out from my toes.
customer_reviews.author: AirplaneMX

customer_reviews.title: true to what a naked shoe should be
customer_reviews.text: great for training calve muscles, don't make the mistake that I did which was logging too many miles all at once coming from cushy shoes. This is by far the best way to build calf and stability muscles. add on a little more miles each week to slowly build up muscles. I wouldn't wear these for a marathon but it sure helps training with these for short distance runs on a soft track.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: ... variations and the Vibram V trail is a top favorite. I do everything in my vibrams so the ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 5 pairs of vibram five fingers in different variations and the Vibram V trail is a top favorite. I do everything in my vibrams so the additional tread is very helpful when I trail run here in Phoenix, AZ. I hope they continue to improve the durability between the large and second toe as I find it rips when trail running and small rocks make their way in between. This can happen early on when the rest of the show is still in great shape. I still love them though due to the feedback you get.
customer_reviews.author: Eric O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: More padding and thicker sole
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly comfortable. They are somewhat more padded than my last pair of Vibrams (And by padded -- I mean upper padding on the top of my foot and the tongue). I put them on and could not get over how they feel like butter on my feet. The bottoms also seem thicker than my other Vibrams. But I am grateful for this, as I'm hoping to do more off-road walking in these. They are still flexible and breathable and all. -- They looked a little goofy on the picture, but I am so pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Momma

customer_reviews.title: Well made minimalist shoe
customer_reviews.text: The construction and material quality is as described by the manufacturer. Although the shoe is advertised for trail running I would only use them for workouts in the health club. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because of the fit. In the past I've bought several KSO EVO cross trainers size 8.5-9 which perfectly conform to my 9.5 feet. However this shoe is exactly a size 9. Thus, I'm dissatisfied with the disparity, albeit minor, between Vibram models. Nonetheless I will continue to purchase these type of shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: N. P. Lizaso

customer_reviews.title: Holding out currentlt
customer_reviews.text: So I took delivery of mine on Friday. Wore them for a couple of hours at work that night (indoors only at this point). Comfortable and easy to walk in. Sunday, went to put them on in the house to continue with the break in process, and when tightening the right drawstring it broke from the Velcro tab. Appears to have been poorly attached. I have reached out to Vibram regarding this, and see what their suggestion/fix will be. Will update when I hear back on this.
customer_reviews.author: JF Hartings

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. They fit very well. Wear a size 10.5 EE in a street shoe and went with the 43's. Tried and purchased my first pair at the Vibram store in Boston. Sales associate recommended trying the 43's first and then the 44's. The 43's which were recommended for size 9.5 to 10, initially felt tight, but once I walked in them they were perfect. I tried the 44's and they were too loose in the toe area which made them uncomfortable. I think you want a snug fit. I would recommend staying true to the size conversion when ordering. Don't upsize.
customer_reviews.author: Bushpigger

customer_reviews.title: Funky looking but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Super functional. I’ve used these for workouts, walking, and Spartan races. They take awhile to get used to but once you do you’ll never go back to regular shoes. If you like Spartan races and other mud runs these are a must! Less risk of losing a shoe and they greatly help with navigating obstacles. I won’t wear anything else any more!
customer_reviews.author: Love Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for previous shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These replaced my previous off-roadl five finger shoes and the size ordered fit as expected (i.e, the same as my previous pair size). They feel great and I like the extra protection in from of the toes (for when I hit a root or rock). Will see if the velcro latch holds up as well as the metal ones the company use to use).
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Love vibram
customer_reviews.text: First, I really enjoy Vibram shoes. I like the pseudo barefoot feel. So, take that into consideration when reading the review. I originally ordered a size 50 because I typically wear a size 14 or 15 US. But... The size 50 was huge. I reordered a size 48, and it fits perfectly. Vibram quality is outstanding. I am very hard on my footwear, and the fivefingers I have owned in the past have done very well for me. My only real advice... If this is your first time with minimalist footwear... Break yourself in slowly. Dont try to go on a 4 mile run in these on your first outing.
customer_reviews.author: WolverineRat

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't take any photos but I love these! I've only worn them for the Tough Mudder so far but my feet felt great..until about mile 7 or 8. The grip was great during the obsticles..and the obsticles people keot losing their shoes in the mud during, these stayed perfectly on my feet. I'm nervous about how long they will last. I'll update my review after i put it through a few more courses and a couple hikes.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for the old spyridons I'd finally worn out. Surprisingly these had a break in period. it was as perfect a fit as I can expect and it caused some initial discomfort in my left second toe, but after a couple of runs it seems to have gone away. Sole seems to protect more than the previous design did and I'm noticing better traction than previous. Overall a great shoe that I can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: mike orr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: The tread of theses shoes are aggressive enough not to slip in wet grass or shallow mud. The upper material is quick drying and I have yet to get the dreaded toe shoe stink from these. Great fit with or without socks, but I highly recommend socks, a little more comfortable where the upper and sole meet near the toe area.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac H.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT.
customer_reviews.text: Tried them on and they fit really well. My little toe has difficulty fitting in the pocket but I have very tapered toes so it's not the design fault. I always take a magnifying glass on any fabric and check the stitching. Really good work Vietnam!!! Very comfortable abound the house so far. When it warms up in the spring I'll wear them more.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Great and light!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. after two months of wear I had a slight issue with the rubber soul in one part of the toe, but Amazon is sending out another. It was just a quality issue! Will definitely buy again! I was impressed that the fabric holds up really well to sticks and briers that try to puncture the shoe. I was worried when I first had them on that I was going to tear something up, but they have held up great!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M. Harp

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoes I own now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a sort of impulse buy. My feet are pretty wide and I've read that this style of shoe works well for wide feet. They work so well, they have become my daily-wear sneakers. Easy to wash and dry quickly. There is no drawback. I love these things.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm about as rough as it gets with any product. So within about a month I had some minor fraying but they feel great and fit correctly (research the size first). They did not and have not lost integrity after 3 months but I also have reduced use based on the climate. I would also recommend buying some sock/shoe fresheners...for the sake of those around you.
customer_reviews.author: Swan313

customer_reviews.title: These are sturdy yet flexible and work well for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy yet flexible and work well for wide feet. The upper material is a little thicker which I'm sure will last a lot longer than the regular mesh ones. The sole does have a little extra traction which allows one to trail run or hike without bruising, but is still very sensitive to the feel of the earth beneath your feet. This is very similar to the Komodo sport LS, which I loved but had trouble finding.
customer_reviews.author: JCrazy8

customer_reviews.title: ... fingers for nearly ten years and have been very satisfied up to this point
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing five fingers for nearly ten years and have been very satisfied up to this point. The shoes are great but one of the tongues seems to just be glued in place - it came lose very easily. I couldn't tell is it wasn't stitched at all or if the stitches tore out. It is an annoyance but I can live with it given the discounted price I paid. I won't stop buying five fingers but I probably won't get this style again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really miss the Speeds.
customer_reviews.text: These are my new spring/summer/fall shoes. The fit as expected. My only complaint about this style is the lacing. The lacing is not good for wide feet with high arches. Just not enough length to be adjustable. Basically have to wear them with the laces all the way loose as they can go. Really miss the Speeds.
customer_reviews.author: K. McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Read me!
customer_reviews.text: I feel unequilly qualified to provide a product review. Living in Hawaii I have literally taken these fivefingers from the beach to cliff jumping, rainforest to waterfalls, and everyday walking to the lava rocks that would shred any shoe product in a single day! Grip is tough and reliable in all environments, comfortable, and attractive. On top of being incredible I was stopped too many times to count for my opinion on comfort and performance. Incredible shoe and a must have in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Flannigan

customer_reviews.title: I was worried that I wouldn't like the extra material
customer_reviews.text: Not too loose. My previous pair is the most minimal KSO EVO which I had been running in. Sometimes a pressure point pain in the KSO EVO in the sole. I use these V-Trails on a mixed terrain. Noticeably thinker. I was worried that I wouldn't like the extra material, feeling constricted. I enjoy this pair a bit more, appreciating a little more support while still having barefoot like movement. And I really enjoy have my toes separate.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best yet
customer_reviews.text: This would be around the 10th pair of VFF which I have had. Hands down my favorite thus far. This is a great daily shoe for me, and with laces it is a little easier to get on. Wear these from the time I leave the house till the time I return to the house. VFF resolved foot, knee, and overall body discomfort years ago for me. Will never turn back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Ok to use in water not beach
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was my first five fingers. It fit as expected. It is a little hard to put on as you have to line up the toes. I got them for the Bahamas. They work great for a water park but were horrible for on the beach. Sand gets in the very difficult to come out. All the sand goes to your toes. They are ok to walk around in not much arch support but that is kind of what those shoes are like so this would be expected. Overall AR great for a day at the water park not sure how good they will be for out stuff where you may me around dirt and sand.
customer_reviews.author: Kristoffer Neu

customer_reviews.title: Why have I waited!?
customer_reviews.text: I used to go barefoot literally everywhere until my wife got pregnant about 6 years ago and she made me start wearing shoes. I’ve known about these forever and finally got some to accommodate a knew interest in trail running. These are literally the most comfy shoes I’ve ever worn, hands down. Zero complaints. I will probably be back to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Davis

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS FOR SIZING ADVICE.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in a quick whim before a July 4th trip. I wear a 9.5 in Nike Free's, So I ordered the size 9-9.5. They unfortunately were too large by an entire size. Returned without a problem & Exchanged the shoes for a 8-8.5; they fit perfectly. If you order these, remember you want them snug because they will eventually stretch a bit. If you where a 9-9.5, drop a size/half size down when buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great way for doing trail running but the fit is somewhat small if you wear socks.
customer_reviews.text: For me they fit very well if I dont use socks. But when I wear them with Injinji Socks I feel them somewhat small. So I recommend if you are planning to buy them with socks add 0.5 on the recomended size. The shoes itself are great. Excelent grip on slipery surfaces. You feel every surface. Ocasionally in hard downhill if you step over a sharp little rock you will feel a disconfort however I think this is the idea of this shoes.
customer_reviews.author: German F.

customer_reviews.title: I won't be running Ultras in them but they are loads of run
customer_reviews.text: I want to give them five stars but I cannot. It is probably more my feet than the shoes as I have long thin feet and long toes. But having said that, I wear them with the socks and it is just enough to hold my feet. I bought these to run in. I owned one of the original designs many years ago and found there just wasn't enough protection for running on the trail. These allow for the fun of barefoot trail running without the intermittent cries of pain as the arch of your foot strikes a rock or root incorrectly. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: I like Vibram shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like Vibram shoes, but this particular style has a seam or stitching that ran right across the top of my bunion. That strikes a nerve and MAN! I can't do that. So I returned these shoes and got a different style. But the "five-finger" shoes are very comfortable. I'm not interested in the claim or dis-claimed aligning of the bones in the foot ... I just think these shoes are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Using Vibrams for several years, these are perhaps my fourth pair. Use V-run for road, and bought these for rocky offroad. They are great. In general, barefoot running is a little bit of a challenge (dont switch completely to it, but do some percentage of your runs on your old shoes for a while), but if you are already a barefoot runner and thinking about these, or a fivefinger runner and thinking about these, then don't hesitate. V-run compared to V-trail? If you're just road running then V-run, otherwise V-trail.
customer_reviews.author: rob martin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, I got the 8
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, I got the 8.5-9 sized Vibrams but I usually wear either size 9 or 9.5 in regular shoes. Definitely ordered the correct size. Very happy with these. They were really hard to get on the first two times, but after that I got the hang of it. Only annoying thing is grass and weeds getting stuck in between the toes.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Love these Weird Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Vibrams! I don't run in em, I like em for Golf, yard work and everyday type wear; and especially for water shoes. If you are doing any excursions in the Ocean or River or Waterfall, these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Skin for Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: Took these on a hike through Turkey Run. I was able to walk right up the water falls with a tight, secure grip on the water-covered rocks. Felt free and confident for 6 hours. Extremely comfortable and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: An affirmation: the technology is in your feet.
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday arrived at their final destination (Colombia) the Vibram V-trail. They are very comfortable, feel like walking or running barefoot but your feet will be protected during roads not very technical (roads without sharp rocks or loose pieces of wood). The fit is as expected, but you need to get used to this type of footwear that "grows" your feet. I will update the review when I have more time to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these give men more stamina in bed
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for a week and my t levels shot up, it could be the trucker Viagra but I think it's the way my feet spread out. so comfy
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable Fivefingers
customer_reviews.text: These V-Trail Fivefingers fit better than my other three pairs of Vibram Fivefingers (TrekSport KSO, Spyridon and KSO, all the same size). Laces allow precise adjustment. Feels soft and comfortable. My only problem was that the shoes arrived with the tags removed and it is obvious that someone else walked with them (not much really, probably only as they tried them on) because the soles were dusty. Other than that the shoes seem to be in perfect condition and I will keep them. Still five stars because the product itself is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo M

customer_reviews.title: Just Barely fit, but I grew Into them
customer_reviews.text: I originally got these for running but I love them so much I wear them everywhere now. Once you get used to the feel these shoes rock. They beat the crap out of your calves but I feel my legs getting stronger. I also like how well they grip and I have been putting these shoes through alot (running my first race in them in may) and the quality is standing. Looking forward to getting another pair! BTW I wear size 10 and they fit perfectly, They felt too small at first but when I wore them around a bit, they fit just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, but my toes got really warm
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes!... I only had them for 2 weeks due they are not Puppy approved. They they comfortable to wear, it is a glove in your feet, every body felt in love of my shoes. I will buy them again when my dog grow up.
customer_reviews.author: J. BOLIVAR

customer_reviews.title: Good for wet slippery surface.
customer_reviews.text: I am rating this based on the spyridon that was stolen by an airport worker. I've used them hiking and working through wet rock in Hawaii on two trips and I've also use it playing a round of golf. I was in the market for another Spyridon but the price went up to $180 from $70. I hope my new V-Trail would perform as well.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes he's ever had
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these and says they're the best shoes he's ever had. I've heard these help relieve pain from walking if you have a back injury and my husband definitely notices a difference in how his feet and back feel when walking in these VS other shoes. The only downside to these shoes is that if you get them wet the dye leaks a lot and stains your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Elsbeth

customer_reviews.title: These shoes feel awesome!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned! It's like walking barefooted but with some protection for the bottoms of my feet. We have Velvet ants here. I now can walk outside in comfort and without fear of being stung in the bottom of my foot. Will buy insulated Vibrams soon for next winter!
customer_reviews.author: Rangar

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite of my over 40 pairs of Vibrams. I've run multiple 100 mile races on trail and gravel.
customer_reviews.author: RevRun Regan

customer_reviews.title: Some issues with sand, gravel, prickly stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've used them for some hikes and runs on and off trail. On sandy trails, they let in some gravel. Off trail, I get poked between the toes by pine needles (I think) and other prickly stuff. Usable for minor hikes and runs, but not as outdoor ready as I'd hoped. Color is visible and shoes elicit questions.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Baker

customer_reviews.title: stitching factory defect in big toe, feels like pebble inside shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The left shoe has a sowing defect that feels like there is a pebble inside the tip of the big toe's pocket, and makes it PAINFUL to wear. This factory defect has been present in all shoes ever released in this model. Vibram, please fix these otherwise perfect shoes! The good things it has are Great grip, and thick durable sole, very comfy and soft inside. Nice warmth and also transpirable. Overall an improvement over the V-Run in most aspects.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Poor sewing quality in toe areas
customer_reviews.text: Wore my new VFF V Trail when it arrived today. First impression? Fitting is ok but insole is not as comfortable as my old VFF KomodoSport. 😰 I put my finger in each toe area. I can feel that the sewing is rough n there r "bulges". Hope I will not get any blisters. 😩 It seems that the earlier model has a better "build" quality. 😔 I strongly recommend VFF to relook into the sewing quality.
customer_reviews.author: James O.

customer_reviews.title: great for running trail or road
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband and he really likes them. Shoes fit as expected, great for running trail or road. The only problem is that they BLEED! Yes, feet and socks turned blue, from wearing them... His feet look like they were covered in monster bruises!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney B.

customer_reviews.title: Yay shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely comfortable. I’ve worn nothing but Vibrams for the last 10 years or so. I run a half marathon every other day, and I’m a cyclist on the off days. I use these for all of it. They’re also great in the gym for weight training.
customer_reviews.author: Tito Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: they're great!
customer_reviews.text: It's important in my experience to make sure that you find out what size you are in these, perhaps in a brick and mortar store, for your first pair. This was my second pair, so I knew exactly what size I wanted. Once your calves and other muscles are accustomed to this type of shoe, they're great!
customer_reviews.author: KeyWord

customer_reviews.title: Trial and error until it fits is ok by me
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair that fits well. Tried other models of VFF of the same size but they fit too tightly and their soles were thinner than I like. Typically wear size 41 and these are 41 so these fit ok. And the sole was thicker. Plus the price was ~$40 cheaper than EMS and REI. I accept this style of footwear will fit 100 people 100 different ways, so I'll just continue to leverage Amazon Prime's free delivery and returns until I find what works for me.
customer_reviews.author: djz

customer_reviews.title: They are extremely nice shoes and seem very well made i with they ...
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence as far as what size to get soni went with the smaller option and it was a little to small so i had to order another pair and get the next size up. They are extremely nice shoes and seem very well made i with they would have had it my size and in the black
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist maximus
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Vibram Fivefingers for about 9 years and the V Trail Runner might be favorite style. The soles are a little thicker and grippier than other Fivefingers running shoes: great for running on/off trail, paved, etc. I like to wear them with toe socks as I live/run in a subtropical, fairly humid climate. Fivefingers, and this pair in particular, are the most comfortable shoes I've worn. I'd wear them more often, not just for physical activities, if my spouse did not find them so aesthetically unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: sanmigilmer

customer_reviews.title: You may have to buy a set before you find the right fit
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sets of Vibrams I had to buy a pair before finally figuring out my side since I bought it online. Really enjoy using them definitely don't jump into wearing these a ton. Build up your feet over time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: So glad to have purchased.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th pair of Vibrams in 6 years. First trail version. Bikila LS were by favorite. These are great on the trail. Started running on true mountain bike trails earlier this year in road versions of FF. So glad I purchased these. Helps on the sharp rocks and roots. Fit was normal to other types of FF. First run was 13.25 miles at the local Whitewater center. Over 30 miles of trails there. Can't wait to run them all in my new V Trail Vibram's
customer_reviews.author: Justin Andrikanich

customer_reviews.title: Get the smaller size
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 in regular shoes and the 44 was too big. Got the 43 and it fit much better.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! For women too!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I am a female and I loved this color blue but they only had them for men, so I did the correct conversion from my size to EU men's and I wear a size 9 in women's and the size I ordered was the 40 which is men's 8 to 8.5US. The fit great! I love this material so much more than the V-Runs which are super thin. These have padding in the back that makes this shoe so comfy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: head-turner during walks in the malls and anywhere else. very comfortable and sturdy. none locally available anymore - makes it a premium product! would not hesitate buying other models again. this is actually my 4th pair. just love this product!
customer_reviews.author: allan trajano

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME 5 Fingers for trail running.
customer_reviews.text: These V Trail 5 fingers are my favorite models ever! They fit like a soft sock. Have traction like a boot and have flexibility like nothing else. If I could wear one shoe for the rest of my life, it would be these.
customer_reviews.author: Upgrade Taos Computers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: You can tell the difference between the $40 and the $85 pair, more rubber underneath and the material is thicker which makes them extra comfortable. I love them. My lower back and hips doesn't hurt at all. I'm hooked. Im buying another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Substantive
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite pair of 5 finger shoes and I have about 5-6 others. These are a little more like a regular shoe with a liner, padding, nice tongue, sole, etc. Yes, I'm a barefoot wimp... so these suit me fine.
customer_reviews.author: CorpGovNet

customer_reviews.title: cant think of a good headline
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time getting my toes in the correct slot...and once I did, some of my toes were scrunched. So based on the trouble of putting them on, I sent them back, they look cool though. Someday I might try a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: wildhorses

customer_reviews.title: A little too rigid, but a good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a different pair of these, which fit my feet like a glove. These, while the fit is as expected, do not quite live up to those expectations. Maybe it is just the fact that I haven't gotten used to them, yet, but they scrape between the toes more.
customer_reviews.author: Dolunay Kiz

customer_reviews.title: The best running shoes money can buy
customer_reviews.text: As usual, another great pair of trail running shoes from Vibram. I had the Bikila's before these and the trek sport before those, and I have never been dissatisfied with Vibram shoes. My past pairs held up to over 2 years of regular running, trail and street. I am sure these new ones will deliver the same longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Martinez

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I tried them on at a brick and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I tried them on at a brick and mortar and am glad I did I chose a 45 not the 46 I would have guessed. I have used them for about 30 - 40 minutes for the first 3 days then last night went for a 3 mile walk. It was a great experience and loved the feeling of being in contact with the surface. G
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Haim

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: If you get the proper fit, these shoes perform great, as Vibram Five Fingers always have. Don't blame the shoe if you can't measure your foot size and if you dont know the proper method to run in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort over everything
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these for my daily footwear and couldn't be happier. Trail running, hiking through Oahu, portaging through the BWCA, these things can do it all. Hiking and running in regular shoes feels clumsy after wearing these for the past 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: M4NNING

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable once I put a heel cup in
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable once I put a heel cup in...you may experience bone bruises when you first start wearing them, however, heel cup cured that...I may put in a short insole for the balls of my feet...if you only use them on grass or baseball fields like surfaces, they are great right out of the box...I use toe sock with them
customer_reviews.author: person

customer_reviews.title: I have about 20 miles of trail running in them so far and I'm not disappointed. I've had Vibram's Bikila
customer_reviews.text: Home Run Vibram. I was blown away at how cushioned it felt while also keeping with the FiveFinger semi-minimalist feel. I have about 20 miles of trail running in them so far and I'm not disappointed. I've had Vibram's Bikila, Spyridon MR, Can't remember the name but they were wool casual wear FF, KSO, and these. I would say these are second only to the KSO in comfort, longevity, and sex appeal.
customer_reviews.author: Von Bren

customer_reviews.title: good fit
customer_reviews.text: 1st one was kind of strange but the second is great, fully cut, not tight, good fit for long walks, sized right. For those who have problems with the color bleeding, wash it before first use and it won't do that.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Toe Shoes - not just for Tools!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought only douchebags wore toe shoes. Then I tried running in them. I love them for running and they are also excellent for box jump. Don’t worry about looking silly - they are fantastic. Just make sure to get toe socks with them too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: ... my third pair of vibrams although these don't fit like the past two have
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of vibrams although these don't fit like the past two have. My foot is the same size but these seem larger than past two models? In general, I love the shoes. I wouldn't work out in anything else!
customer_reviews.author: rdub

customer_reviews.title: Great support while maintaining "Feel"!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cradle sole, provides support without loss of "Feel". Bought another exact pair two weeks later for backup. I've been wearing Vibram 5 fingers for the last six years!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Runyon

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.text: Vibram never fails. These shoes are awesome. They fall in line with the MR Spyridon. To me this has more of a cussioned feel inside but dies not diminish thr minimalist experience at all. I bought thses shoes and they are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Exodus

customer_reviews.title: otherwise these are very comfortable, just as i expected
customer_reviews.text: i want to give it 5 stars but the right shoe rubs a hot spot into the top of my foot. i have several other vff shoes and this is the only one that's ever done that. otherwise these are very comfortable, just as i expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a 10.5 US normal width shoe. The 44 seems to fit well. I have a little room at the end of the toes as suggested. There is not much padding in the heel, but I am enjoying wearing them. Took me a while to spread my toes to get them in the proper toe slots. I like the traction soles. Will test them out in the Sierras later in September. I picked up a PCT thru hiker and he has been wearing this model while hiking through N. CA and Oregon. He said you got to learn to walk in them and not stub your toe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is snug like it's supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: I am usually a 9 in a normal shoes and thats with some wiggle room. This shoe is snug like it's supposed to be, I had extra room in all my toes but my big toe. Its pretty tight on my big toe, no room really. Its close against the heel as well. I order 8.5-9. I would send it back for a half size bigger but I'm afraid its be too big. I don't want to go through the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun shoes
customer_reviews.text: These toasters are so comfortable I wear them everywhere. I've been wearing them on a lot of hikes here in Colorado and if you follow the directions and build your foot strength up slowly they will serve you well . Very well constructed with a good thick sole. If you like running around in your bare feet these are the shoes to get
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen K. Zug

customer_reviews.title: perfect for rough tarrein and for begginers in general
customer_reviews.text: i changed to this type of vff to be able to run on dirt roads and a bit offtrail (before i had the kso and the kso evo). the sole is much tougher and in general the shoes feels stronger. i think the sole is also a bit thicker couse its much nicer to run long distances with them. to sum it all, its great shoes for rough tarrein and long distances, and especially i will recomande them for begginers with vff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great traction when climbing up/down slippery slopes and they dry ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a Spartan race and they exceeded my expectations! They are light even covered in mud plus they kept the dirt and rocks out. Great traction when climbing up/down slippery slopes and they dry quickly as well. Buy these if you enjoy running barefoot but need the added protection.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Harkness

customer_reviews.title: I wear a 13 and it fits!
customer_reviews.text: I had to find a few sizes but euro 48 was the best fit for my size 13 feet. There’s a little room for my toe socks that I got separately since I don’t like wearing any shoes barefoot. May want to go a Zoe down if you want them very snug.
customer_reviews.author: Ur2phine

customer_reviews.title: Always Good
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of Vibram in general and the whole concept of a splayed toe system. Ordered the Blue/Black 10.5-11 and they fit perfect for me. Comfy around the top with good grips on the soul. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Teamour Bagwaddles

customer_reviews.title: This is my first pair of Vibram's It feels a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Vibram's It feels a bit odd at first, but you get used to it. 4* Because they could stand to be a little more cushioned
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes don't last long, under 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Shoes rip and tread disappears. Have had the shoes for under 9 months. Bought Dec26th, shortly past the new year. I cannot advise on if you should buy or not, but currently I am not planning on buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: James Hale

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for running.
customer_reviews.text: Made of high quality and durable materials. This is my second pair and I put over 2000 miles in my first pair. These are some of the best running shoes I have ever used. Only 2 cons are that your feet will get wet if worn in the water or snow and they get stinky if worn without socks.
customer_reviews.author: Kresgerunner

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, kinda small.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes but they run a little smaller than all the other Vibrams I own. I absolutely suggest buying one size up from your normal Vibram size. I can still wear them but it's a battle to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: VinDaddy

product_meta.title: Vibram Men's V Trail Runner
product_meta.description: Vibram’s five-fingers v-trao; running shoes provide the perfect balance of proprioception (foot sensory impact) and protection on rugged surfaces. Our two-color 5mm vibram rubber sole provides impact protection from stones and debris, whilst allowing a more natural running style. The aggressive tread design and vibram 3d cocoon technology moulded into the sole delivers sure-footed grip and protection in all directions. All in all, the v-trail is the ideal choice for the barefoot runner who is looking to take their style to the tough terrain.NOTE:Wide foot may need to size up
feature_bullets: Vibram 3D Cocoon technology molded into the sole provides rock-stopping protection, now extended further into the ball area
Multi-directional lug design for grip all over!
Sole Spec: INSOLE: 2mm EVA + NZYM Anti-Microbial Poly Fabric Sockliner MIDSOLE: N/A RUBBER: 2-color 5MM + 3D Cocoon Mesh
